thread.title: Beyoncé's Grammys performance was magical perfection, obviously
thread.title_full: Beyoncé's Grammys performance was magical perfection, obviously

author: Proma Khosla
title: Beyoncé's Grammys performance was magical perfection, obviously
text:
Beyoncé's Grammys performance was magical perfection, obviously 0 Share What's This? Mandatory Credit: Photo by Stephen Lovekin/REX/Shutterstock (6323743af) Beyonce Knowles 'Tidal X 10/15' concert at the Barclays Center, New York, USA - 15 Oct 2016 Image: Stephen Lovekin/REX/Shutterstock By Proma Khosla 2017-02-13 02:19:59 UTC 
It's no longer a surprise, but always a blessing, when Beyoncé performs at an awards show. The singer — now pregnant with twins, in case you forgot — took the stage at the 2017 Grammys, and as is her style, she slayed. SEE ALSO: David Bowie swept all 5 posthumous Grammy nominations for 'Blackstar' 
Beginning with an intro video and poetry excerpts from Lemonade — after being introduced by her mom —Beyoncé wowed us by leaning backward in a chair on stage and performing the slower, soulful pieces from her latest album, including "Love Drought" and "Sandcastles."
